intro: Pouteria beaurepairei, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, elongated leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces a capsule fruit that contains up to 20 seeds, which are the commercially valuable Brazil nuts. Its botanical structure includes a thick, rough bark and a complex root system adapted to nutrient-poor soils. The plant plays a significant ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various wildlife species.
